sentences.english: Or do I need a competition game plan?
sentences.chinese: 或者我需要計劃一下中獎的“大業”嗎？

sentences.english: Just a little, but caught wind says to want to forget himself, and cause contacts.
sentences.chinese: 只是阿一卻撞見小風說要遺忘本人，和大業交往。

sentences.english: However, it took Zhu Yuanzhang nearly 20 more years to consolidate his hold over the whole country.
sentences.chinese: 此後，他又用近20年的時間，完成了統一大業。

sentences.english: About 100 famous actors worked for nothing on "The Founding of a Republic".
sentences.chinese: 有100名左右的知名演員免費參演了《建國大業》。

sentences.english: The re-unification of HK promotes the unification of China.
sentences.chinese: 香港迴歸祖國促進祖國統一大業。

sentences.english: Small wind and cause finally also maintain friends.
sentences.chinese: 小風與大業最終也維持朋友關係。

sentences.english: Hoo,I heard that the famous Jianguodaye is being shot day and night.
sentences.chinese: 吼，我聽說建國大業正在日以繼夜地拍呢。

sentences.english: Fresh progress has been made in the great cause of national reunification.
sentences.chinese: 祖國統一大業取得新進展。

sentences.english: Self-confidence is the first requisite to great undertakings.
He begins to question whether there is really any hope in Stannis's cause.
sentences.chinese: 他開始懷疑史坦尼斯王的大業是否還有希望。

sentences.english: The government of Cape Verde abides by the one-China principle and supports China's grand cause of reunification.
sentences.chinese: 佛政府恪守一箇中國原則，支持中國統一大業。

sentences.english: And, for the great cause above history would have in turn also choose also.
sentences.chinese: 而青史之上，舉大業者亦莫不有擇於轉折也。

sentences.english: Arab nations would adhere to the one-China policy and support China's peaceful reunification.
sentences.chinese: 阿方堅持一箇中國政策，支持中國和平統一大業。

sentences.english: All men who have achieved great things have been great dreamers .
sentences.chinese: 成就大業著皆是大夢想家。

sentences.english: About 100 famous actors worked for nothing on “The Founding of a Republic”.
sentences.chinese: 在《建國大業》中，約有一百位知名演員無償出演。

definition: to found a state/to open a closed country
to form an alliance/to ally oneself with/allied with/aligned/to bond with
surname Jin/the Jin Dynasties (265-420)/Western Jin 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316), Eastern Jin 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420) and Later Jin Dynasty (936-946)/short name for Shanxi province 山西[Shan1 xi1]
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
large scale program of lasting importance/project of paramount importance/to think big/annual national audit
